item.title: if not ifelse or if_else then what else?
item.description: It is almost impossible to miss the ifelse() and if_else() functions in R. It’s the goto functions when you want to write an if-statement and apply the logic to every element of that vector. The hablar package introduces if_else_(), giving you a third way to do a vectorised if-else in R. Let’s take an example: library(dplyr) library(hablar) library(lubridate) df <- tibble(name = c("John", "Lisa", "Astrid"), birthday = ymd("1976-04-15", "1983-02-03", "1883-10-27")) name birthday John 1976-04-15 Lisa 1983-02-03 Astrid 1883-10-27 In the data frame above you can see that the birthday of Astrid is in the year 1883, which we argue is an incorrect birthday.
